hero.title: Prefiguration Lab
hero.body: We study the collective processes and practices of positive social change in the health, education, transportation, and technology sectors.
focus: Not sure we need this box

projectsCopy: Our research projects explore the processes and practices to open pathways towards desirable futures.

projects.title: Liminal becomings: the professionalization project of peer support workers
projects.blurb: We examine how peer support workers have sought over the last two decades to carve out a space for their practice within the professional sector of mental health care.

projects.title: The shack: negotiating (dis)order in a learning center for homeschoolers
projects.blurb: We explore how board administrators, parents, and staff educators influence an alternative pedagogal space operating outside of the formal school system.

projects.title: Prefigurative pedagogy: reimagining the business school for sustainable futures
projects.blurb: We experiment with new ways of learning together that foster utopian imagination to guide actions in the present.

projects.title: Cycling activism: unveiling the dynamics of bottom-up change for sustainable cities
projects.blurb: We investigate the formation of entrepreneurial ecosystems for social change to create urban communities where active transportation is the norm and car is the exception.

projects.title: How digital rights activists rein in regulatory entrepreneurs: the case of Clearview AI
projects.blurb: We examine how activists mobilize regulatory frameworks and public opinion to defend against the incursions of technology companies into citizens' digital rights.

teamCopy: A research group led by Prof. Mathieu Bouchard and a group of student researchers exploring activism for desirable futures.

team.name: Prof. Mathieu Bouchard
team.bio: Mathieu Bouchard is an assistant professor of strategy and organization at the University of Ottawa's Telfer School of Management. He studies activism for desirable futures to create a better world in the present.

team.name: Adithiyan Rajan
team.bio: Adithiyan Rajan is a Computer Science graduate student who specializes in transforming cutting-edge AI and Machine Learning research into practical, high-impact solutions that address complex, multidisciplinary challenges.

team.name: Phuong Tran
team.bio: Phuong Tran is a Business Technology Management student at the Telfer School of Management, exploring the intersection of emerging technologies, digital policy, and user-centric design in research and practice.

team.name: Camila Estrada
team.bio: Camila Estrada is an accounting student at the University of Ottawa involved in research on cycling activism, with an interest in how people are motivated to create change in their communities.

team.name: Hamza Tawdi
team.bio: Hamza Tawdi is a graduate of the Telfer School of Management with a Bachelor of Commerce degree. His work focuses on analysis, synthesis, and writing, with an emphasis on making information accessible. He is actively involved in community and environmental initiatives.

podcastCopy: The Vivre sans voiture / Living Without a Car podcast hosts conversations about activism for healthy and sustainable urban transportation.
